adoptionRate.title: Global Adoption Rate
adoptionRate.description: Average AI adoption across all countries

inequalityGap.title: Inequality Gap
inequalityGap.description: Global North vs South adoption gap

about.title: About GAII
about.description: GAII (Global AI Inequality Index) measures AI accessibility inequality. 0 means complete equality, 100 means extreme inequality. Data Source: Microsoft Global AI Adoption 2025 Report

worldMap.title: Global GAII Map
worldMap.description: Click on a country to see details. The redder the color, the more severe the AI inequality. Gray countries have no data.

gaiiReport.reportSubtitle: Measuring AI Access, Affordability, Language Support, and Skills Across 50 Countries

header.keyFindings: Key findings from the GAII Report v1.0

aiInequality.title: AI Inequality is Real and Measurable
aiInequality.description: The average GAII score is {{score}}, indicating significant global AI inequality.

northSouthGap.title: Global North vs South Gap
northSouthGap.description: AI adoption in developed countries ({{north}}%) is {{ratio}}x higher than developing regions ({{south}}%).

affordability.title: Affordability is the Biggest Barrier
affordability.description: Global average affordability score is only {{score}}/100, with AI costs consuming up to 30% of income in the poorest countries.

language.title: Language Support is Critical
language.description: Languages spoken by billions have limited AI support, with average language score of {{score}}/100.

gaiiReport.callToAction: AI companies, governments, and international organizations must work together to close the AI inequality gap. The AlmaNEO Foundation calls for tiered pricing, multilingual AI development, and investment in digital infrastructure to ensure AI benefits all of humanity.

globalDivide.title: The Global AI Divide is Widening
globalDivide.description: AI adoption in Global North (33.2%) is 3.5x higher than Global South (9.5%), creating a digital divide that reinforces existing inequalities.
globalDivide.recommendation: Prioritize infrastructure investment and affordable AI access in developing regions.

affordabilityCosts.title: AI Costs Burden Low-Income Countries
affordabilityCosts.description: In countries like Bangladesh and Pakistan, AI subscription costs represent 25-28% of average monthly income, making AI tools inaccessible for most citizens.
affordabilityCosts.recommendation: Develop tiered pricing models and free tiers for low-income regions.

languageBarrier.title: Language Barrier Excludes Billions
languageBarrier.description: Over 3 billion people speak languages with limited AI support. Local language AI quality averages only 35/100 in South Asia and 28/100 in Sub-Saharan Africa.
languageBarrier.recommendation: Invest in multilingual AI models and community-driven translation efforts.

infrastructureGap.title: Infrastructure Gap in Rural Areas
infrastructureGap.description: Urban-rural digital divide persists even in middle-income countries. Internet penetration drops by 30-40% in rural areas.
infrastructureGap.recommendation: Expand mobile connectivity and offline-capable AI applications.

aiLiteracy.title: AI Literacy Crisis
aiLiteracy.description: Global average AI literacy score is only 42/100. Even in developed countries, over 60% of the population lacks basic AI understanding.
aiLiteracy.recommendation: Integrate AI education into school curricula and workforce training programs.

tieredPricing.title: Implement Tiered Pricing for Emerging Markets
tieredPricing.description: AI companies should offer income-adjusted pricing tiers, making AI tools accessible to users in low-income countries at $1-5/month instead of $20+.
tieredPricing.impact: Could increase AI access for 2+ billion people in Global South.

nationalInfrastructure.title: Invest in National AI Infrastructure
nationalInfrastructure.description: Governments should prioritize broadband expansion, data center development, and public AI computing resources.

multilingualSupport.title: Expand Multilingual AI Support
multilingualSupport.description: Prioritize development of AI capabilities in underserved languages including Hindi, Bengali, Swahili, and Vietnamese.
multilingualSupport.impact: Would serve 2.5+ billion speakers of underserved languages.

aiLiteracyPrograms.title: Launch AI Literacy Programs
aiLiteracyPrograms.description: Partner with local organizations to deliver AI education through community centers, libraries, and mobile units.
aiLiteracyPrograms.impact: Build grassroots AI capability in underserved communities.

equityFund.title: Establish Global AI Equity Fund
equityFund.description: Create international funding mechanism to subsidize AI access for least developed countries.
equityFund.impact: Systematic approach to addressing AI inequality.

gaiiMetric.title: Include GAII in National Development Metrics
gaiiMetric.description: Adopt GAII as official indicator alongside HDI and GDP to track AI inequality.
gaiiMetric.impact: Increases visibility and accountability for AI equity.

regionalInsights.NA: North America shows high AI adoption but significant cost barriers for lower-income populations.
regionalInsights.EU: Europe demonstrates strong infrastructure but varies widely in AI literacy across member states.
regionalInsights.EA: East Asia leads in infrastructure quality with South Korea and Singapore as global leaders.
regionalInsights.SA: South Asia faces major affordability challenges with AI subscriptions costing up to 28% of monthly income.
regionalInsights.SEA: Southeast Asia shows rapid growth potential with Singapore as regional hub.
regionalInsights.LA: Latin America benefits from Spanish language support but faces infrastructure gaps.
regionalInsights.ME: Middle East shows polarized development with UAE leading while conflict zones lag behind.
regionalInsights.SSA: Sub-Saharan Africa has critical infrastructure and affordability gaps requiring urgent intervention.
regionalInsights.OC: Oceania achieves near-universal access with Australia and New Zealand as benchmarks.
regionalInsights.CA: Central Asia shows moderate development with growing investment in digital infrastructure.

executiveSummary.subtitle: Key findings from the GAII Report v1.0

countryRankings.title: Country Rankings
countryRankings.subtitle: GAII scores for 50 countries (lower is better)
